title: Sri Lanka rupee quoted at 280/290 to the US dollar
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – The US dollar was quoted at 280/290 to the US dollar in late afternoon trade Monday, dealers said with a float of the currency yet to take hold.
Commercial Banks were selling dollars to customers at 285 for telegraphic transfers and buying at 270 to the US dollar.
Data shows that liquidity is still being injected. The float is hamstrung by a surrender requirement and low interest rates, analysts have said.

China is considering giving a billion US dollar loan and a 1.5 billion US dollars of buyers credit to Sri Lanka, following a request for a 1.5 billion US dollar facility, China’s ambassador to Colombo Qi Shenzong said.
Economists have urged the central bank to raise rates. (Colombo/Mar21/2022)
